qas.question: African  Americans were sent to the pepper coast to do what?

answers.text: establish a colony for freed African Americans.

qas.question: By 1837 the ACS had assisted in moving how many african americans to liberia?
What did African Americans who were moved to Liberia identify as?
Who did Americo-Liberians not identify with?

answers.text: indigenous natives of the tribes they encountered

qas.question: What did African Americans moved to Liberia keep from America?
In what year did volunteers leave the Pepper Coast?
What organization was formed by Americo-Liberians?
How many African Americans migrated to Liberia in 1867?
What did African Americans moved to Liberia keep secret from the ACS?
What were natives of the Pepper Coast called?

context: In <b5_0>1822<b5_0/>, <b6_0>the American Colonization Society<b6_0/> began sending African-American volunteers to the Pepper Coast to <a0_0>establish a colony for freed African Americans.<a0_0/> By 1867, the ACS (and state-related chapters) had assisted in the migration of more than <a1_0><b7_0>13,000<b7_0/><a1_0/> African Americans to Liberia. These free African Americans and their descendants married within their community and came to identify as <a2_0><b9_0>Americo-Liberians<b9_0/><a2_0/>. Many were of mixed race and educated in American culture; they did not identify with the <a3_0>indigenous natives of the tribes they encountered<a3_0/>. They intermarried largely within the colonial community, developing an ethnic group that had a <a4_0><b8_0>cultural tradition<b8_0/><a4_0/> infused with American notions of political republicanism and Protestant Christianity.
